title: Why is Nicolas Tesla's discovery of light bulb overshadowed by Thomas Edison's? - Quora

response.answer_text: Tesla’s lighting equipment used Carbon Arc technology as opposed to Edison’s incandescent technology. Carbon arc bulbs produce a lot of light, but much of the light they put out is ultraviolet - and therefore the bulbs are unusable for indoor lighting. They also use a lot more power than any other lighting technology. Carbon arc bulbs were used in streetlights, gymnasium lighting and the graphic arts…and as soon as a better technology came out, the people using carbon arc lighting converted to the better lighting almost immediately. Tesla’s lighting equipment has been overshadowed by Edison’s because no one wants carbon arc lighting anymore.
